meta.content: Chromebooks, handouts & school supplies will be distributed at the Middle School on Monday, March 23 10am-4pm. Per Governor Cooper, Charlotte Lab School will remained closed due to the COVID-19...

div.style: background-image: url("//cdn2.editmysite.com/images/editor/theme-background/stock/Doctor.jpg") ;background-repeat: no-repeat ;background-position: undefined undefined ;background-size: 100% ;background-color: transparent ;background-size: cover;

div.font:
Chromebooks, handouts & school supplies will be distributed at the Middle School on Monday, March 23 10am-4pm.
Per Governor Cooper, Charlotte Lab School will remained closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic from March 16-May 15, 2020.
div.br:
​
​Here are Links & Resources about COVID-19:
National Information Sources:
Travel advice from the World Health Organization: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/travel-advice
Travel recommendations for international travel: https://www.who.int/news-room/articles-detail/updated-who-recommendations-for-international-traffic-in-relation-to-covid-19-outbreak
​Daily situation reports: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/situation-reports/
Signs & Symptoms of COVID-19: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/COVID19-symptoms.pdf
FERPA: ​https://www2.ed.gov/policy/gen/guid/fpco/ferpa/index.html
CDC Implementation of Mitigation Strategies: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf
See below for Dr. Moss' COVID-19 Letter 3.13.2020 UPDATE:

td.div:

Charlotte, NC 28202
